byline.contributor: Karen Crouse contributed reporting from Indianapolis and Naila-Jean Meyers from London.

abstract: Australian Jason Day, world's No 1-ranked golfer, pulls out of 2016 Rio Olympics over concerns about Zika virus; joins handful of other top golfers, prompting calls to drop sport, which is being included in Games for first time since 1904.

headline.print_headline: Top-Ranked Day Will Skip Rio Games, Citing Zika
headline.main: Jason Day, World’s Top Golfer, Pulls Out of Olympics Over Zika Fears

snippet: Day, an Australian who won last year’s P.G.A. Championship for his first major title, is the latest elite golfer to drop out of the Rio Games.
lead_paragraph: Day, an Australian who won last year’s P.G.A. Championship for his first major title, is the latest elite golfer to drop out of the Rio Games.
